[2006-11-27 @ 15:28:28] #9328 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]1. Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#9328 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#9328 * moderator support#9328 * editing/deleting of posts#9328 * unlimited database#9328 * nested replies#9328 * locking of threads#9328 * a proper help#9328 * stickies#9328 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#9328 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#9328 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-11-27 @ 17:32:49] #2105 %|9|Basics: Post paths%|0|#2105 Post paths are simply a way of indicating the path to a post. They are a series#2105 of numbers separated by slashes. For example, the post path to the 3rd reply#2105 to post 5 would be %|11|5/3%|0|, while the path to the 1st reply to that reply#2105 would be %|11|5/3/1%|0|. If you wanted to read this post, you would type:#2105 %|11|+news 5/3/1

[2006-11-27 @ 18:07:09] #8512 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#8512 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#8512 type:#8512 %|11|+news#8512 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#8512 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#8512 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#8512 read a particular post, type:#8512 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#8512 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#8512 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#8512 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#8512 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.
[2006-11-27 @ 18:07:09] #5 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#5 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#5 type:#5 %|11|+news#5 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#5 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#5 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#5 read a particular post, type:#5 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#5 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#5 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#5 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#5 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.
[2006-11-27 @ 18:07:15] #4777 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#4777 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#4777 type:#4777 %|11|+news#4777 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#4777 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#4777 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#4777 read a particular post, type:#4777 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#4777 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#4777 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#4777 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#4777 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.
[2006-11-27 @ 18:07:29] #8512 %|9|Basics: Post paths%|0|#8512 Post paths are simply a way of indicating the path to a post. They are a series#8512 of numbers separated by slashes. For example, the post path to the 3rd reply#8512 to post 5 would be %|11|5/3%|0|, while the path to the 1st reply to that reply#8512 would be %|11|5/3/1%|0|. If you wanted to read this post, you would type:#8512 %|11|+news 5/3/1

[2006-11-27 @ 18:08:22] #4777 %|9|Basics: Post paths%|0|#4777 Post paths are simply a way of indicating the path to a post. They are a series#4777 of numbers separated by slashes. For example, the post path to the 3rd reply#4777 to post 5 would be %|11|5/3%|0|, while the path to the 1st reply to that reply#4777 would be %|11|5/3/1%|0|. If you wanted to read this post, you would type:#4777 %|11|+news 5/3/1

Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#17805 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#17805 * moderator support#17805 * editing/deleting of posts#17805 * unlimited database#17805 * nested replies#17805 * locking of threads#17805 * a proper help#17805 * stickies#17805 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#17805 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#17805 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-11-27 @ 23:02:38] #8712 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#8712 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#8712 type:#8712 %|11|+news#8712 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#8712 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#8712 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#8712 read a particular post, type:#8712 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#8712 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#8712 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#8712 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#8712 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.
[2006-11-27 @ 23:02:38] #21218 Command not found. Check %|11|+news help commands%|0| for a list of commands.

[2006-11-27 @ 23:02:55] #17805 %|9|Basics: Post paths%|0|#17805 Post paths are simply a way of indicating the path to a post. They are a series#17805 of numbers separated by slashes. For example, the post path to the 3rd reply#17805 to post 5 would be %|11|5/3%|0|, while the path to the 1st reply to that reply#17805 would be %|11|5/3/1%|0|. If you wanted to read this post, you would type:#17805 %|11|+news 5/3/1
[2006-11-27 @ 23:02:57] #21218 %|9|Read: %|11|+news %|12|<postpath>%|11|#21218 Using this command you can read news, which is kind of the purpose of having the#21218 newsboard here in the first place.

[2006-11-27 @ 23:03:21] #21218 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#21218 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#21218 type:#21218 %|11|+news#21218 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#21218 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#21218 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#21218 read a particular post, type:#21218 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#21218 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#21218 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#21218 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#21218 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.

[2006-11-27 @ 23:04:49] #8712 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#8712 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#8712 type:#8712 %|11|+news#8712 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#8712 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#8712 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#8712 read a particular post, type:#8712 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#8712 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#8712 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#8712 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#8712 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.

Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#21218 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#21218 * moderator support#21218 * editing/deleting of posts#21218 * unlimited database#21218 * nested replies#21218 * locking of threads#21218 * a proper help#21218 * stickies#21218 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#21218 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#21218 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-11-27 @ 23:18:51] #17892 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#17892 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#17892 type:#17892 %|11|+news#17892 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#17892 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#17892 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#17892 read a particular post, type:#17892 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#17892 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#17892 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#17892 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#17892 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.

[2006-11-28 @ 09:29:07] #4777 %|11|Help topics%|0| (type %|11|+news help help%|0| for how to use this)#4777 %|1|Basics: Posting%|0|: How to post and reply to posts#4777 %|1|Basics: Post paths%|0|: What they are and how to use them#4777 %|1|Basics: Editing and deleting%|0|: How to edit and delete your posts.#4777 %|1|About%|0|: Technical details#4777 %|1|Commands%|0|: List of all commands#4777 %|1|Notifications%|0|: Notifications, messages and what they are.#4777 %|1|Feedback%|0|: How to have your say#4777 %|1|Basics: Reading posts%|0|: How to see recent posts and read them
[2006-11-28 @ 09:29:45] #4777 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#4777 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#4777 type:#4777 %|11|+news#4777 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#4777 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#4777 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#4777 read a particular post, type:#4777 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#4777 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#4777 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#4777 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#4777 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.
[2006-11-28 @ 09:30:07] #4777 %|9|Basics: Post paths%|0|#4777 Post paths are simply a way of indicating the path to a post. They are a series#4777 of numbers separated by slashes. For example, the post path to the 3rd reply#4777 to post 5 would be %|11|5/3%|0|, while the path to the 1st reply to that reply#4777 would be %|11|5/3/1%|0|. If you wanted to read this post, you would type:#4777 %|11|+news 5/3/1

[2006-11-28 @ 18:02:29] #5 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]1. Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#5 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#5 * moderator support#5 * editing/deleting of posts#5 * unlimited database#5 * nested replies#5 * locking of threads#5 * a proper help#5 * stickies#5 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#5 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#5 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-11-29 @ 00:37:38] #8512 %|9|Notifications%|0|#8512 Notifications and messages exist to keep you abrest of what's happening on the#8512 newsboard. Both have slightly different functions. %|11|Notifications%|0| are#8512 sent to you when you log on, if there are unread posts or replies on the#8512 newsboard. %|11|Messages%|0| on the other hand will be sent to you whenever a#8512 new post (or reply) is made. Both of these can be controlled using preferences -#8512 see help on %|11|Notify%|0| and %|11|Message%|0|.

[2006-11-29 @ 08:37:32] #1534 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]1. Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#1534 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#1534 * moderator support#1534 * editing/deleting of posts#1534 * unlimited database#1534 * nested replies#1534 * locking of threads#1534 * a proper help#1534 * stickies#1534 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#1534 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#1534 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-11-30 @ 16:20:40] #4777 %|11|Help topics%|0| (type %|11|+news help help%|0| for how to use this)#4777 %|1|Basics: Posting%|0|: How to post and reply to posts#4777 %|1|Basics: Post paths%|0|: What they are and how to use them#4777 %|1|Basics: Editing and deleting%|0|: How to edit and delete your posts.#4777 %|1|About%|0|: Technical details#4777 %|1|Commands%|0|: List of all commands#4777 %|1|Notifications%|0|: Notifications, messages and what they are.#4777 %|1|Feedback%|0|: How to have your say#4777 %|1|Basics: Reading posts%|0|: How to see recent posts and read them
[2006-11-30 @ 16:20:52] #4777 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#4777 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#4777 type:#4777 %|11|+news#4777 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#4777 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#4777 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#4777 read a particular post, type:#4777 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#4777 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#4777 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#4777 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#4777 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.
[2006-11-30 @ 16:21:02] #4777 %|9|Basics: Post paths%|0|#4777 Post paths are simply a way of indicating the path to a post. They are a series#4777 of numbers separated by slashes. For example, the post path to the 3rd reply#4777 to post 5 would be %|11|5/3%|0|, while the path to the 1st reply to that reply#4777 would be %|11|5/3/1%|0|. If you wanted to read this post, you would type:#4777 %|11|+news 5/3/1

[2006-12-01 @ 16:45:25] #3948 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]1. Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#3948 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#3948 * moderator support#3948 * editing/deleting of posts#3948 * unlimited database#3948 * nested replies#3948 * locking of threads#3948 * a proper help#3948 * stickies#3948 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#3948 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#3948 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-12-01 @ 19:53:56] #4360 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]1. Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#4360 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#4360 * moderator support#4360 * editing/deleting of posts#4360 * unlimited database#4360 * nested replies#4360 * locking of threads#4360 * a proper help#4360 * stickies#4360 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#4360 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#4360 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#6118 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#6118 * moderator support#6118 * editing/deleting of posts#6118 * unlimited database#6118 * nested replies#6118 * locking of threads#6118 * a proper help#6118 * stickies#6118 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#6118 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#6118 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-12-07 @ 03:11:50] #17934 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]1. Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#17934 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#17934 * moderator support#17934 * editing/deleting of posts#17934 * unlimited database#17934 * nested replies#17934 * locking of threads#17934 * a proper help#17934 * stickies#17934 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#17934 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#17934 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-12-09 @ 11:49:00] #4360 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]1. Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#4360 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#4360 * moderator support#4360 * editing/deleting of posts#4360 * unlimited database#4360 * nested replies#4360 * locking of threads#4360 * a proper help#4360 * stickies#4360 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#4360 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#4360 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-12-09 @ 23:53:11] #2484 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]6/1. That's not the date[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-09 00:27}))]#2484 That's the month. Time and date on NewsBoard are in YYYY-MM-DD HH-MM form, run off DS9 (Cubey's server). There are plans in the works to allow different time formats, but they are low on the priority list (read: I could do it, but I'm more interested in seeing if anything will break first).

[2006-12-11 @ 03:16:57] #5 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]7. [BUILDERS] Crafting System[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-11 03:16}))]#5 OK, I have a plan to build me a house (yes, I have the TARDIS. I'm building a house too, dammit). One of the things I was going to implement (because I love interactive stuff) was a crafting system. Fool has one, but that requires modification of the MARE hard-code and as a result ain't too easy to port. The system I was planning on using would be based on combining ingredients in an object, then using the object. If the object recognised the combination of ingredients, it would create a new object based on them. Exact ingredients would have to be used.#5 %rThe technical stuff - this is how I imagine it would work. You would need:#5 *  A crafting parent (contains the command and code to craft an object)#5 *  A sub-parent (contains a list of possible items that can be crafted in this object, plus needed ingredients)#5 * Ingredients (techs)#5 %rThe ingredients would be placed in the crafting item and the command used. The object passes the contents to the craft function, which would check the contents against the list from the sub-parent (using wcount and match). If anything matched, the ingredients would be destroyed and the product created. Otherwise, nothing.#5 %rIt's rather above what I've done so far and it also messes with techs (which I haven't played with before). Anyone got any ideas, comments, etc?

[BUILDERS] Crafting System[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-11 03:16}))]#8712 OK, I have a plan to build me a house (yes, I have the TARDIS. I'm building a house too, dammit). One of the things I was going to implement (because I love interactive stuff) was a crafting system. Fool has one, but that requires modification of the MARE hard-code and as a result ain't too easy to port. The system I was planning on using would be based on combining ingredients in an object, then using the object. If the object recognised the combination of ingredients, it would create a new object based on them. Exact ingredients would have to be used.#8712 %rThe technical stuff - this is how I imagine it would work. You would need:#8712 *  A crafting parent (contains the command and code to craft an object)#8712 *  A sub-parent (contains a list of possible items that can be crafted in this object, plus needed ingredients)#8712 * Ingredients (techs)#8712 %rThe ingredients would be placed in the crafting item and the command used. The object passes the contents to the craft function, which would check the contents against the list from the sub-parent (using wcount and match). If anything matched, the ingredients would be destroyed and the product created. Otherwise, nothing.#8712 %rIt's rather above what I've done so far and it also messes with techs (which I haven't played with before). Anyone got any ideas, comments, etc?

Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#1895 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#1895 * moderator support#1895 * editing/deleting of posts#1895 * unlimited database#1895 * nested replies#1895 * locking of threads#1895 * a proper help#1895 * stickies#1895 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#1895 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#1895 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-12-11 @ 21:49:30] #1895 %|11|Help topics%|0| (type %|11|+news help help%|0| for how to use this)#1895 %|1|Basics: Posting%|0|: How to post and reply to posts#1895 %|1|Basics: Post paths%|0|: What they are and how to use them#1895 %|1|Basics: Editing and deleting%|0|: How to edit and delete your posts.#1895 %|1|About%|0|: Technical details#1895 %|1|Commands%|0|: List of all commands#1895 %|1|Notifications%|0|: Notifications, messages and what they are.#1895 %|1|Feedback%|0|: How to have your say#1895 %|1|Basics: Reading posts%|0|: How to see recent posts and read them
[2006-12-11 @ 21:49:46] #1895 %|9|Help: %|11|+news help [topic|command]#1895 The help command is used to find help. There are four main uses of the help#1895 command:#1895 %|11|help%|0|#1895 Displays the main help screen, including a list of basic help topics.#1895 %|11|help <topic>%|0|#1895 Displays help on a topic in particular.#1895 %|11|help commands%|0|#1895 Displays all commands available.#1895 %|11|help <command>%|0|#1895 Displays more verbose help on a particular command.#1895 Any of these can be accessed by typing %|11|+news%|0| followed by whatever#1895 command you want. You don't have to type the whole command, usually part of#1895 it will do.
[2006-12-11 @ 21:49:59] #1895 Multiple topics match your search: Basics: Posting, Basics: Post paths, Basics: Editing and deleting, Basics: Reading posts.
[2006-12-11 @ 21:50:09] #1895 No help found on that topic.
[2006-12-11 @ 21:50:12] #1895 %|9|Basics: Posting%|0|#1895 To post something to the newsboard, simply type:#1895 %|11|+news post %|12|<title>%|11|=%|12|<body>#1895 This will create a news post with title of %|12|title%|0| and content of#1895 %|12|body%|0|.#1895 To reply to an existing post, type:#1895 %|11|+news reply %|12|<post path> <title>%|11|=%|12|<body>#1895 For more information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#1895 The other options are the same as for posting.
[2006-12-11 @ 21:50:54] #1895 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#1895 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#1895 type:#1895 %|11|+news#1895 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#1895 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#1895 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#1895 read a particular post, type:#1895 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#1895 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#1895 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#1895 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#1895 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.
[2006-12-11 @ 21:51:09] #1895 %|9|Basics: Post paths%|0|#1895 Post paths are simply a way of indicating the path to a post. They are a series#1895 of numbers separated by slashes. For example, the post path to the 3rd reply#1895 to post 5 would be %|11|5/3%|0|, while the path to the 1st reply to that reply#1895 would be %|11|5/3/1%|0|. If you wanted to read this post, you would type:#1895 %|11|+news 5/3/1

[2006-12-11 @ 21:51:46] #1895 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]6/1. That's not the date[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-09 00:27}))]#1895 That's the month. Time and date on NewsBoard are in YYYY-MM-DD HH-MM form, run off DS9 (Cubey's server). There are plans in the works to allow different time formats, but they are low on the priority list (read: I could do it, but I'm more interested in seeing if anything will break first).
[2006-12-11 @ 21:52:06] #1895 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]7. [BUILDERS] Crafting System[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-11 03:16}))]#1895 OK, I have a plan to build me a house (yes, I have the TARDIS. I'm building a house too, dammit). One of the things I was going to implement (because I love interactive stuff) was a crafting system. Fool has one, but that requires modification of the MARE hard-code and as a result ain't too easy to port. The system I was planning on using would be based on combining ingredients in an object, then using the object. If the object recognised the combination of ingredients, it would create a new object based on them. Exact ingredients would have to be used.#1895 %rThe technical stuff - this is how I imagine it would work. You would need:#1895 *  A crafting parent (contains the command and code to craft an object)#1895 *  A sub-parent (contains a list of possible items that can be crafted in this object, plus needed ingredients)#1895 * Ingredients (techs)#1895 %rThe ingredients would be placed in the crafting item and the command used. The object passes the contents to the craft function, which would check the contents against the list from the sub-parent (using wcount and match). If anything matched, the ingredients would be destroyed and the product created. Otherwise, nothing.#1895 %rIt's rather above what I've done so far and it also messes with techs (which I haven't played with before). Anyone got any ideas, comments, etc?

[2006-12-11 @ 23:27:34] #2484 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]7. [BUILDERS] Crafting System[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-11 03:16}))]#2484 OK, I have a plan to build me a house (yes, I have the TARDIS. I'm building a house too, dammit). One of the things I was going to implement (because I love interactive stuff) was a crafting system. Fool has one, but that requires modification of the MARE hard-code and as a result ain't too easy to port. The system I was planning on using would be based on combining ingredients in an object, then using the object. If the object recognised the combination of ingredients, it would create a new object based on them. Exact ingredients would have to be used.#2484 %rThe technical stuff - this is how I imagine it would work. You would need:#2484 *  A crafting parent (contains the command and code to craft an object)#2484 *  A sub-parent (contains a list of possible items that can be crafted in this object, plus needed ingredients)#2484 * Ingredients (techs)#2484 %rThe ingredients would be placed in the crafting item and the command used. The object passes the contents to the craft function, which would check the contents against the list from the sub-parent (using wcount and match). If anything matched, the ingredients would be destroyed and the product created. Otherwise, nothing.#2484 %rIt's rather above what I've done so far and it also messes with techs (which I haven't played with before). Anyone got any ideas, comments, etc?

[2006-12-12 @ 04:56:06] #8512 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]7. [BUILDERS] Crafting System[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-11 03:16}))]#8512 OK, I have a plan to build me a house (yes, I have the TARDIS. I'm building a house too, dammit). One of the things I was going to implement (because I love interactive stuff) was a crafting system. Fool has one, but that requires modification of the MARE hard-code and as a result ain't too easy to port. The system I was planning on using would be based on combining ingredients in an object, then using the object. If the object recognised the combination of ingredients, it would create a new object based on them. Exact ingredients would have to be used.#8512 %rThe technical stuff - this is how I imagine it would work. You would need:#8512 *  A crafting parent (contains the command and code to craft an object)#8512 *  A sub-parent (contains a list of possible items that can be crafted in this object, plus needed ingredients)#8512 * Ingredients (techs)#8512 %rThe ingredients would be placed in the crafting item and the command used. The object passes the contents to the craft function, which would check the contents against the list from the sub-parent (using wcount and match). If anything matched, the ingredients would be destroyed and the product created. Otherwise, nothing.#8512 %rIt's rather above what I've done so far and it also messes with techs (which I haven't played with before). Anyone got any ideas, comments, etc?

This means a raft of new features, including:#97 * moderator support#97 * editing/deleting of posts#97 * unlimited database#97 * nested replies#97 * locking of threads#97 * a proper help#97 * stickies#97 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#97 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. [2006-12-16 @ 14:30:26] #2105 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]7. [BUILDERS] Crafting System[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-11 03:16}))]#2105 OK, I have a plan to build me a house (yes, I have the TARDIS. I'm building a house too, dammit). One of the things I was going to implement (because I love interactive stuff) was a crafting system. Fool has one, but that requires modification of the MARE hard-code and as a result ain't too easy to port. The system I was planning on using would be based on combining ingredients in an object, then using the object. If the object recognised the combination of ingredients, it would create a new object based on them. Exact ingredients would have to be used.#2105 %rThe technical stuff - this is how I imagine it would work. You would need:#2105 *  A crafting parent (contains the command and code to craft an object)#2105 *  A sub-parent (contains a list of possible items that can be crafted in this object, plus needed ingredients)#2105 * Ingredients (techs)#2105 %rThe ingredients would be placed in the crafting item and the command used. The object passes the contents to the craft function, which would check the contents against the list from the sub-parent (using wcount and match). If anything matched, the ingredients would be destroyed and the product created. Otherwise, nothing.#2105 %rIt's rather above what I've done so far and it also messes with techs (which I haven't played with before). Anyone got any ideas, comments, etc?

[2006-12-18 @ 15:49:22] #1705 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]1. Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#1705 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#1705 * moderator support#1705 * editing/deleting of posts#1705 * unlimited database#1705 * nested replies#1705 * locking of threads#1705 * a proper help#1705 * stickies#1705 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#1705 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#1705 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-12-19 @ 11:40:01] #3404 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]1. Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#3404 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#3404 * moderator support#3404 * editing/deleting of posts#3404 * unlimited database#3404 * nested replies#3404 * locking of threads#3404 * a proper help#3404 * stickies#3404 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#3404 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#3404 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2006-12-25 @ 23:10:53] #9428 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]7. [BUILDERS] Crafting System[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-11 03:16}))]#9428 OK, I have a plan to build me a house (yes, I have the TARDIS. I'm building a house too, dammit). One of the things I was going to implement (because I love interactive stuff) was a crafting system. Fool has one, but that requires modification of the MARE hard-code and as a result ain't too easy to port. The system I was planning on using would be based on combining ingredients in an object, then using the object. If the object recognised the combination of ingredients, it would create a new object based on them. Exact ingredients would have to be used.#9428 %rThe technical stuff - this is how I imagine it would work. You would need:#9428 *  A crafting parent (contains the command and code to craft an object)#9428 *  A sub-parent (contains a list of possible items that can be crafted in this object, plus needed ingredients)#9428 * Ingredients (techs)#9428 %rThe ingredients would be placed in the crafting item and the command used. The object passes the contents to the craft function, which would check the contents against the list from the sub-parent (using wcount and match). If anything matched, the ingredients would be destroyed and the product created. Otherwise, nothing.#9428 %rIt's rather above what I've done so far and it also messes with techs (which I haven't played with before). Anyone got any ideas, comments, etc?
[2006-12-25 @ 23:11:51] #9428 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]8. Heads-up on sittables[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-25 17:17}))]#9428 Over the next few days (or weeks, depending on how much free time I get) you may notice some funny behaviour with sittables. This is because I'm trying to put all the code on the sittable objects themselves and do away with a horrible universal monitor object that we currently have. We apologise for the inconvenience, and I'll have stuff running properly again as soon as I have free time and can corner swing to do some stuff.

[2006-12-28 @ 02:17:36] #17746 %|9|Help: %|11|+news help [topic|command]#17746 The help command is used to find help. There are four main uses of the help#17746 command:#17746 %|11|help%|0|#17746 Displays the main help screen, including a list of basic help topics.#17746 %|11|help <topic>%|0|#17746 Displays help on a topic in particular.#17746 %|11|help commands%|0|#17746 Displays all commands available.#17746 %|11|help <command>%|0|#17746 Displays more verbose help on a particular command.#17746 Any of these can be accessed by typing %|11|+news%|0| followed by whatever#17746 command you want. You don't have to type the whole command, usually part of#17746 it will do.
[2006-12-28 @ 02:17:55] #17746 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#17746 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#17746 type:#17746 %|11|+news#17746 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#17746 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#17746 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#17746 read a particular post, type:#17746 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#17746 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#17746 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#17746 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#17746 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.

[2006-12-28 @ 02:18:09] #17746 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]1. Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#17746 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#17746 * moderator support#17746 * editing/deleting of posts#17746 * unlimited database#17746 * nested replies#17746 * locking of threads#17746 * a proper help#17746 * stickies#17746 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#17746 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#17746 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

Heads-up on sittables[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-25 17:17}))]#17892 Over the next few days (or weeks, depending on how much free time I get) you may notice some funny behaviour with sittables. This is because I'm trying to put all the code on the sittable objects themselves and do away with a horrible universal monitor object that we currently have. We apologise for the inconvenience, and I'll have stuff running properly again as soon as I have free time and can corner swing to do some stuff.

[2007-01-02 @ 22:28:12] #1534 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]7. [BUILDERS] Crafting System[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-11 03:16}))]#1534 OK, I have a plan to build me a house (yes, I have the TARDIS. I'm building a house too, dammit). One of the things I was going to implement (because I love interactive stuff) was a crafting system. Fool has one, but that requires modification of the MARE hard-code and as a result ain't too easy to port. The system I was planning on using would be based on combining ingredients in an object, then using the object. If the object recognised the combination of ingredients, it would create a new object based on them. Exact ingredients would have to be used.#1534 %rThe technical stuff - this is how I imagine it would work. You would need:#1534 *  A crafting parent (contains the command and code to craft an object)#1534 *  A sub-parent (contains a list of possible items that can be crafted in this object, plus needed ingredients)#1534 * Ingredients (techs)#1534 %rThe ingredients would be placed in the crafting item and the command used. The object passes the contents to the craft function, which would check the contents against the list from the sub-parent (using wcount and match). If anything matched, the ingredients would be destroyed and the product created. Otherwise, nothing.#1534 %rIt's rather above what I've done so far and it also messes with techs (which I haven't played with before). Anyone got any ideas, comments, etc?
[2007-01-02 @ 22:29:42] #5 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]7. [BUILDERS] Crafting System[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-11 03:16}))]#5 OK, I have a plan to build me a house (yes, I have the TARDIS. I'm building a house too, dammit). One of the things I was going to implement (because I love interactive stuff) was a crafting system. Fool has one, but that requires modification of the MARE hard-code and as a result ain't too easy to port. The system I was planning on using would be based on combining ingredients in an object, then using the object. If the object recognised the combination of ingredients, it would create a new object based on them. Exact ingredients would have to be used.#5 %rThe technical stuff - this is how I imagine it would work. You would need:#5 *  A crafting parent (contains the command and code to craft an object)#5 *  A sub-parent (contains a list of possible items that can be crafted in this object, plus needed ingredients)#5 * Ingredients (techs)#5 %rThe ingredients would be placed in the crafting item and the command used. The object passes the contents to the craft function, which would check the contents against the list from the sub-parent (using wcount and match). If anything matched, the ingredients would be destroyed and the product created. Otherwise, nothing.#5 %rIt's rather above what I've done so far and it also messes with techs (which I haven't played with before). Anyone got any ideas, comments, etc?

[2007-01-08 @ 16:33:45] #21765 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]1. Hello and welcome[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-11-22 03:28}))]#21765 Hi there, and welcome to the NEW AND IMPROVED NewsBoard 2.0. There's been a bunch of changes between 1.0 and 2.0, the biggest of which easily being the change between tinyMARE and ruby for the backend of the board. This means a raft of new features, including:#21765 * moderator support#21765 * editing/deleting of posts#21765 * unlimited database#21765 * nested replies#21765 * locking of threads#21765 * a proper help#21765 * stickies#21765 There's still a few things I want to patch up, but I also want to start putting this board through some more rigourous testing. Basically, I'm sick of poking this code to see where it breaks. It's your turn. You can do this by posting, replying, checking the help and doing what you can. If you have any bug reports or suggestions on how to improve NewsBoard, post them here or +mail me with them and I'll see what I can do.#21765 %rI should add that my mother recently underwent surgery on her hand, so she's currently one-handed and in need of a lackey to do her work. That means me, and that means I don't have as much time as I usually would have over the (for use here in New Zealand) summer break. I'll try and get on top of any bugs I find. It should also be interesting to see how updating code while the NewsBoard is up will go.#21765 %rAnyway, have fun on here and start posting!

[2007-01-08 @ 16:35:27] #21765 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]6/1. That's not the date[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-09 00:27}))]#21765 That's the month. Time and date on NewsBoard are in YYYY-MM-DD HH-MM form, run off DS9 (Cubey's server). There are plans in the works to allow different time formats, but they are low on the priority list (read: I could do it, but I'm more interested in seeing if anything will break first).
[2007-01-08 @ 16:35:42] #21765 [s(strcat(%|,get(#8512,color),|,{[esc(1m)]6/2. Dates[esc(2m)] by [name(#8512)] @ 2006-12-12 04:59}))]#21765 The mare is based on the Shire Callendar from LOTR, going with the origional Windsmare which had a LotR themed mare. (Hence the name Gandalf I believe). So, since each shire month is the same length, this can lend itsself to some discrepancies with our system.
[2007-01-08 @ 16:36:00] #21765 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]7. [BUILDERS] Crafting System[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-11 03:16}))]#21765 OK, I have a plan to build me a house (yes, I have the TARDIS. I'm building a house too, dammit). One of the things I was going to implement (because I love interactive stuff) was a crafting system. Fool has one, but that requires modification of the MARE hard-code and as a result ain't too easy to port. The system I was planning on using would be based on combining ingredients in an object, then using the object. If the object recognised the combination of ingredients, it would create a new object based on them. Exact ingredients would have to be used.#21765 %rThe technical stuff - this is how I imagine it would work. You would need:#21765 *  A crafting parent (contains the command and code to craft an object)#21765 *  A sub-parent (contains a list of possible items that can be crafted in this object, plus needed ingredients)#21765 * Ingredients (techs)#21765 %rThe ingredients would be placed in the crafting item and the command used. The object passes the contents to the craft function, which would check the contents against the list from the sub-parent (using wcount and match). If anything matched, the ingredients would be destroyed and the product created. Otherwise, nothing.#21765 %rIt's rather above what I've done so far and it also messes with techs (which I haven't played with before). Anyone got any ideas, comments, etc?
[2007-01-08 @ 16:36:58] #21765 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]8. We apologise for the inconvenience, and I'll have stuff running properly again as soon as I have free time and can corner swing to do some stuff.#21765 %rReplies:#21765 %t[esc(7m)]1)[esc(0m)] [NEW] [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]And they're working again! [2007-01-21 @ 04:38:52] #9328 %|11|Help topics%|0| (type %|11|+news help help%|0| for how to use this)#9328 %|1|Basics: Posting%|0|: How to post and reply to posts#9328 %|1|Basics: Post paths%|0|: What they are and how to use them#9328 %|1|Basics: Editing and deleting%|0|: How to edit and delete your posts.#9328 %|1|About%|0|: Technical details#9328 %|1|Commands%|0|: List of all commands#9328 %|1|Notifications%|0|: Notifications, messages and what they are.#9328 %|1|Feedback%|0|: How to have your say#9328 %|1|Basics: Reading posts%|0|: How to see recent posts and read them
[2007-01-21 @ 04:39:43] #9328 %|9|Basics: Reading posts%|0|#9328 To see the most recent posts (including "stickies", or important posts), just#9328 type:#9328 %|11|+news#9328 Unread news items will have a [NEW] before them, and unread replies are marked#9328 at the end of the title in parentheses. If a post has any unread content#9328 (counting the post itself and replies) the index number will be highlighted. To#9328 read a particular post, type:#9328 %|11|+news %|12|<post number>#9328 This will show the news article, as well as any replies and other notes about#9328 the post. If you wish to read replies, type a post path instead of a post#9328 number. For information on post paths, type %|11|+news help post path%|0|.#9328 For more ways to view posts, check the help on %|11|history%|0| and %|11|show full%|0|.
[2007-01-21 @ 04:40:29] #9328 %|9|Basics: Post paths%|0|#9328 Post paths are simply a way of indicating the path to a post. They are a series#9328 of numbers separated by slashes. For example, the post path to the 3rd reply#9328 to post 5 would be %|11|5/3%|0|, while the path to the 1st reply to that reply#9328 would be %|11|5/3/1%|0|. If you wanted to read this post, you would type:#9328 %|11|+news 5/3/1

[2007-01-21 @ 04:42:23] #9328 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]6/1. That's not the date[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-09 00:27}))]#9328 That's the month. Time and date on NewsBoard are in YYYY-MM-DD HH-MM form, run off DS9 (Cubey's server). There are plans in the works to allow different time formats, but they are low on the priority list (read: I could do it, but I'm more interested in seeing if anything will break first).
[2007-01-21 @ 04:42:53] #9328 [s(strcat(%|,get(#8512,color),|,{[esc(1m)]6/2. Dates[esc(2m)] by [name(#8512)] @ 2006-12-12 04:59}))]#9328 The mare is based on the Shire Callendar from LOTR, going with the origional Windsmare which had a LotR themed mare. (Hence the name Gandalf I believe). So, since each shire month is the same length, this can lend itsself to some discrepancies with our system.
[2007-01-21 @ 04:43:50] #9328 [s(strcat(%|,get(#5,color),|,{[esc(1m)]7. [BUILDERS] Crafting System[esc(2m)] by [name(#5)] @ 2006-12-11 03:16}))]#9328 OK, I have a plan to build me a house (yes, I have the TARDIS. I'm building a house too, dammit). One of the things I was going to implement (because I love interactive stuff) was a crafting system. Fool has one, but that requires modification of the MARE hard-code and as a result ain't too easy to port. The system I was planning on using would be based on combining ingredients in an object, then using the object. If the object recognised the combination of ingredients, it would create a new object based on them. Exact ingredients would have to be used.#9328 %rThe technical stuff - this is how I imagine it would work. You would need:#9328 *  A crafting parent (contains the command and code to craft an object)#9328 *  A sub-parent (contains a list of possible items that can be crafted in this object, plus needed ingredients)#9328 * Ingredients (techs)#9328 %rThe ingredients would be placed in the crafting item and the command used. The object passes the contents to the craft function, which would check the contents against the list from the sub-parent (using wcount and match). If anything matched, the ingredients would be destroyed and the product created. Otherwise, nothing.#9328 %rIt's rather above what I've done so far and it also messes with techs (which I haven't played with before). Anyone got any ideas, comments, etc?
